reviews.text: We recently said 2 nights at this Marriott property. Friendly & prompt check-in upon arrival. Lovely room with excellent bedding. However, maid service was very poor--no toilet paper in room upon arrival and the room unserviced the second day--dirty glasses, no towels, bathroom left dirty, etc. Ordered room service for breakfast--terrible! Complained to management and they removed the charges from our bill. Prompt service upon telephoning front desk but disappointed with these different problems....not up to a Marriott property.
reviews.title: Below Average for Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was fine, but nothing special. The rooms were okay and pretty clean. Linens and major fixtures were clean, but there wasn't great attention to detail in the cleaning though (dust in the corners, dirty grout around the border of the bathroom, etc.). The service at the hotel was so-so. Maintenance was very helpful when we had a problem with the toilet, but the front desk left something to be desired. We had a giftcard issued by Marriott to us that we gave them upon check-in. It took the woman at the front desk forever to process it, but then she finally told us we were all set and had been credited the money. Then, when we went to check out, another front desk person said there was "no record" of the card. We eventually had to call a manager to get it taken care of. Big waste of time!
reviews.title: Not quite up to par for a Marriott, but adequate

reviews.text: We were disappointed with our recent stay at the South Park Marriott. Although the front desk and bellman were very pleasant and helpful, the service in areas such as room service and restaurant fell far short of what we expected. After our room service meal was delivered, we had to call back for them to deliver cream for the coffee and silverware! Needless to say by the time they came back, the rest of the meal was cold. They only had one person bartending and waitressing in the afternoon. No fault to this lonely employee who was trying to serve everyone to the best of their ability, but was not able to provide prompt service. Aside from the service, there was mold growing on the bathtub tiles. I was interested to see if they would clean it the next day (which they did not). The maid service also knocked on the door and asked if we we "needed anything". I thought daily cleaning was the norm for Marriott and it was not necessary to request this service. The computer area for business and customer use was at the junction of two hallways with alot of noise and traffic. The computer was also facing the center of the room making everything on the screen visible to the other people standing around. I would not stay at this hotel again with so many other options in the immediate area.
reviews.title: Didn't meet expectations of a Marriott

reviews.text: Upon entering my room, I inspected the room. I observed mold like substance in the right corner of the shower. Prior to leaving the building for dinner, I went to the front to request that the shower be cleaned. 3 hours later I returned from dinner, and the problem still existed. While I was out, I purchased shower shoes, and thank god I did. I showed the photos to the staff member as I checked out on June 25.
reviews.title: Shower not properly cleaned

reviews.text: We stopped off in Charlotte on the way back from a family holiday on the Gulf Coast, Florida. The hotel is within walking distance of the South Park mall and easy driving to local restaurants.
reviews.title: They couldn't do enough for us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel several times and have always thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The parking is free, the lobby is lovely, the rooms are roomy and nicely decorated. We especially appreciated the numerous, easily accessible electrical outlets. So many hotels have few and are behind beds, armoires, etc. There are even outlets on both sides of the large marble vanity in the bathroom. The staff are friendly and helpful. When we checked in, we were informed that a wedding party was occupying most of the 6th (top) floor, but our room was on the 4th, so we should have no problem with noise--and they were correct. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but we had drinks in the lounge (again, lovely) and another time outside on the patio. Service was prompt. The upscale shopping areas and eating establishments are an extra plus. Toscana, a wonderful restaurant, is a few steps away. There are many others only a 2-5 minute drive away. I'm not sure about in-room internet, but there is a computer downstairs for free use.
reviews.title: lovely hotel in a lovely area

reviews.text: Stayed over due to a strom and a missed fligh, we stayed at the marriot at Indianapolis and the difference is overwhelming, this hotel is not worth the money I was charged, the room was ok but it needs renovations and better cleaning service
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic - I was greeted with Raspberry Brandy and truffles upon entering the lobby. Right across the street from the swanky Southpark mall (Neiman Marcus, Louis Vuitton, etc). Bed was very comfortable, room was spotless and the marble vanity in the bathroom was lovely.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night with my daughter and mother-in-law for a weekend shopping trip to Charlotte, including South Park Mall. This hotel is within walking distance to South Park. There is an up scale shopping and dining area right outside the hotel also. Room was clean, beds were comfortable, and and staff were prompt and friendly. Room rate included breakfast buffet, which was varied and tasty. I would definately stay here again if going to the South Park area.
reviews.title: Great place for a weekend shopping trip to South Park Mall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Suppose to be a romantic gettaway. Could not find it in the middle of an office park. Looked horrible from the out side. Interior...red galor.
reviews.title: Give me a break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, kudos to Restaurant.com, because I would not have found the restaurant without them. The boyfriend and I went there for an early dinner last week and the food and service rocked.
reviews.title: The Grill: One of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had

reviews.text: I was not super hungry so I ordered the Maryland Jumbo Crabcake and a tossed salad. Boyfriend order the Pot Roasted Shortrib with roasted carrots and cheddar mashed potatoes. He also ate a tossed salad.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay!

reviews.text: Our salads came out immediately with an order of bread. While I wasn't a fan of the bread they set on the table, boyfriend loved it and ordered more. The salad was fresh, crisp, and absolutely delicious. We both commented that if they did a great job with tossed salad, we knew we were in for a treat. We were both in a chatty mood and didn't mind the wait for our food. I new boyfriend's order would like a little extra time, but before our salad forks hit the plate for the last time, the waiter (who was fantastic by the way), brought our entrees. The aroma was straight from foodie heaven. Boyfriend and I traded bites from our plates. I was instantly in love with my crabcake and I know seafood. Boyfriend doesn't even like seafood but he said "thats good." So there. Also, honorable mention for the bread on my sandwhich. This was no pick up by the hands sandwich. In my opinion, it is best eaten open faced with a fork, and so I did.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.text: Boyfriend's shortrib was indescribedly great. Like the kids say, "oh my goodness!" That was a lot of food and my hungry man was loving every bite. He gave me three bites of his shortrib and then I knew without a doubt that he really loved me. (smile)
reviews.title: A pleasant stay
Really nice hotel
reviews.text: Later, we ordered Wam Apple & Walnut Cobbler that came ala mode with vanilla ice cream. This made my foodie senses soar! The walnuts were seasoned, perhaps in cinnamon sugar which knocked this desert into the foodie hall of fame. Of course this dessert was accompanied by cups of freshly brewed coffee. The chef was obviously professionally trained at a fine institute and it showed that he/she appreciated fine dining. We loved our dining experience. Thankfully, we were headed to go shopping and walk around for hours.
The entrance was modern and spectacular. The check in virtually unnoticeable... the ambiance was fantastic and overwhelmed with the details...one did not notice the friendly agents.
reviews.title: Loved Everything

reviews.text: The room was clean, bed linen fresh. Ver nice rooms with all the modern equipment. Bathrooms clean.....Bed and comforter very comfortable.
reviews.title: Increditable!!!!!

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good, and the waitresses very nice. A little disappointed that there were very few options for those of us that do not eat pork. This could potentially become a problem if one prepays for breakfast and then given few choices.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for an event and/or putting up a large group

reviews.text: This hotel was amazing! It was VERY clean, the room svc, customer sv, restaurant svc was all excellent! The staff all the way around was very friendly and accommedating. "Catering" Is a good word to use! I ordered room svc a couple of times and it seemed like it never took more than 10mins! Loved that too! I took a cab from hotel to the mall only because it was too cold for ME to walk. It cost only a couple of bucks. I ask the restaurant to call me a cab. They said that the cab co. said it would be there in 30mins. at this point I was ready to walk the short distance! I called the hotel...They had one to come get me in 5mins! Thanks Jim! I arrived at the hotel at 2p. There hotel restaurant closes between 2p-4p to reopen for dinner. They stayed open so that my friends and I could eat after our long flight! We stayed in there past 4p enjoying lunch and there company! We also returned later that same evening to entertain other visiting guest of ours at about 930p. We stayed til they closed with no rush on their part both times. I liked that the lounge stays open late! They made us feel like a celebrities! The area was said to be the most expensive location in charlotte and the service I receive here was proof! Truthfully, this area caters to a large variety of spenditures from restaurants to shopping! I like that. There is a ton of things to do! Lots of mini shops and restaurants in walking distance literally! As well as a Galleria shopping mall across the street. This hotel is not far from the Uptown entertainment district either where you will find a vast variety of even more things to do! Valet parking was only 5 bucks if your feeling too lazy to park your car and walk maybe 15 steps to the door! ALL FOR 100 BUCK A NIGHT! LOVELY!!!! A MUST STAY!!! Dining: Rooster was an awesome place for dinner! Maggiano's at the mall for dinner. Delicious! The Bricktop for brunch! Yummy!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the Marriott at Southpark for our daughter's Bat Mitzvah party last year. We booked the Morrisoin ballroom downstairs including the foyer and the two adjacent smaller parlors which we used as "quiet" rooms for people who wanted to get away from the noise. For our out of town guests, we booked a large block of rooms at the hotel and we booked the Presidential Suite for Sunday so that we could offer our guests any easy way to do brunch before they left for the weekend.
reviews.title: A bit disappointing I'm afraid!
